title: Augusta County: Samuel Franklin Carson to his Brother, October 7, 1863
summary: Carson writes his brother, discussing increasing desertion rates and the generally improving health of his fellow soldiers. In the postscript, he asks that his brother send him a pair of boots and some rations, explaining that food is running low, it now costs cash, and officers haven't been payed in some time. He also mentions a trip to Richmond.
keywords: Camp Life, Troop Movement, Desertion/Leave, Family, Medicine/Hospitals, American Civil War
